question: Can I afford a mortgage for a $300,000 home with an annual income of $85,000 and a credit score of 720?
true_answer: Yes, with an income of $85,000 and credit score 720, DTI at 28% is affordable. Suggest 10-20% down payment.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage for a $300,000 home with an annual income of $85,000 and a credit score of 720?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for affordability check. 2) Involve credit_agent for credit validation. 3) Use calculator for DTI. 4) Supervisor to review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability criteria.
Common affordability criteria include DTI below 36% and adequate down payment.
Credit score 720 is excellent for mortgage approval.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio for mortgage affordability.
DTI calculated as 28%, which is affordable.
What are the typical down payment requirements?
Retrieving information on down payment requirements.
Down payments typically range from 10-20% of the home value.
Is my ideal payment plan feasible?
Review complete, feasibility confirmed for provided inputs.
Yes, your plan is feasible. DTI at 28% is affordable, and down payment can be 10-20%.
Yes, with an income of $85,000 and credit score 720, DTI at 28% is affordable. Suggest 10-20% down payment.
